From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To display the System Event Archive (SEA) logs, use the **show logging system** command in user EXEC mode or privileged EXEC mode.
CLIs: show logging system [ disk [ <file-location> ] | last [ num-of-last-log-msgs ] ]

ParaDef.Info: (Optional) Displays SEA logs from the specified file location.  The **disk** keyword when used along with *file-location* argument displays SEA logs from the specified file location.

Examples: The following example shows a sample output of the show logging system command that displays the specified number of latest system log messages:
SEQ: MM/DD/YY HH:MM:SS MOD/SUB: SEV, COMP, MESSAGE
1: 01/24/07 15:38:40 6/-1 : MAJ, GOLD, syndiagSyncPinnacle failed in slot 6
2: 01/24/07 15:38:40 6/-1 : MAJ, GOLD, queryHyperionSynched [ 6 ] : Hyperion out of sync in
3: 01/24/07 15:38:40 6/-1 : MAJ, GOLD, queryHyperionSynched [ 6 ] : Hyperion out of sync in
4: 01/24/07 15:38:40 6/-1 : MAJ, GOLD, queryHyperionSynched [ 6 ] : Hyperion out of sync in
5: 01/24/07 15:38:40 6/-1 : MAJ, GOLD, queryHyperionSynched [ 6 ] : Hyperion out of sync in
6: 01/24/07 15:38:40 6/-1 : MAJ, GOLD, queryHyperionSynched [ 6 ] : Hyperion out of sync in
7: 01/24/07 15:38:39 6/-1 : MAJ, GOLD, queryHyperionSynched [ 6 ] : Hyperion out of sync in
[ Table 100 ] (#wp1563405) describes the significant fields shown in the display.
Table 100 show logging system Field Descriptions
| MOD/SUB | Module or the submodule that generated the log message. |
| SEV | Severity level of the message. |
| COMP | Software component that has logged the message. |
The following example shows a sample output of the show logging system command that displays SEA logs from the specified file location:
Router# show logging system disk disk0:my_log.dat
SEQ: MM/DD/YY HH:MM:SS MOD/SUB: SEV, COMP, MESSAGE
1: 02/01/95 00:35:51 2/3/-1: MAJ, GOLD, lc_ctrl_proc_obfl_info:test SEA log in
The following example shows a sample output of the show logging system command on the Cisco uBR10012 Router:
SEQ: MM/DD/YY HH:MM:SS MOD/SUB: SEV, COMP, MESSAGE

The following command is used to identify the disk on PRE currently being used to store the sea_log.dat file. The following example shows a sample output of the show logging system disk command executed on the Cisco uBR10012 router:
The following command is used to view the specified number of log messages stored in the
sea_log.dat file. The following example shows a sample output of the show logging system last 10
command on the Cisco uBR10012 router:
SEQ: MM/DD/YY HH:MM:SS MOD/SUB: SEV, COMP, MESSAGE
ExtraInfo: The **show logging system** command displays the latest messages first.

RelatedCmds.description: Clears the event records stored in the SEA.
Copies the archived system events to another location.
Enables or disables the SEA logging system.
